intro: Acianthera silvae, commonly known as the forest violet orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial herb that typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories. The plant produces delicate, violet-colored flowers with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Acianthera silvae is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological role in forest ecosystems.
